definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
fast/greedy/run rapidly
to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.chinese: 反而变得急功近利，好高骛远。

sentences.english: Right now, many commentators are urging Mr. Obama to think small.
sentences.chinese: 当前，很多评论家都在奉劝奥巴马不要过于好高骛远。

sentences.english: It is relatively easy to envision an outcome that results from thinking big.
sentences.chinese: 好高骛远的人们会比较容易想到事情的结果。

sentences.english: Have ambition at everywhere and not idealistic and not practical, stand on solid ground but challenge extreme limit again.
sentences.chinese: 志在四方又不好高骛远，脚踏实地而又挑战极限。

sentences.english: We can't always have our head in the cloud, we need to be down-to-earth.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能总是那么好高骛远，我们要脚踏实地。

sentences.english: Our nature, gentle, treats people sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 此人，性格平和，不好高骛远，待人真挚。

sentences.english: People should be down-to-earth, instead of being over-ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 做人应该脚踏实地，不要好高骛远。

definition: to have high standards but little ability/to be fastidious but incompetent (idiom)
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. the next mountain looks taller (idiom); fig. not satisfied with one's current position/the grass is always greener on the other side of the fence
pinyin: zhe4 shan1 wang4 zhe5 na4 shan1 gao1

definition: unrealistic/impractical
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
complacent/self-satisfied
to be shortsighted
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
short-sighted
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
